subject: Nutrition
title: Night Blindness Through History
description: Learn Night Blindness Through History in one minute.

hook.text: Ancient Egyptians treated night blindness by feeding patients liver. They didn't know why it worked.

buildup.text: Night blindness is the inability to see in dim lightâ€”often the first sign of vitamin A deficiency.

discovery.text: Liver is one of the richest vitamin A sources, which the retina needs to produce light-sensing pigments.

twist.text: During World War I, night-blind soldiers were treated with cod liver oilâ€”it worked within days.

climax.text: Today, vitamin A deficiency still blinds 500,000 children per year, mostly in Asia and Africa.

punchline.text: A cure known for 3,500 years still hasn't reached everyone.
